attributes.action: ensure that Downing Street E-Petitions are available in the search engine and not hidden under the 'electronic' carpet
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to

rejection.details:
Concerns on specific legal cases should be raised directly with the Home Office. We cannot, for example, verify the details of every individual case or clarify whether or not an individual named has given permission for this. The E-petition site exists for people to request changes to Government policy.
Comments on the e-petitions process itself should be sent to number10@petitions.gov.uk while further information is available on http://petitions.pm.gov.uk/faq and also http://petitions.pm.gov.uk/terms.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
